intro: Pyramidanthe schlechteri, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of flowers at the ends of its branches. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
